reviewText: Of course, these films are ads created by the National Parks Service in order to garner tourists to parks in the west and ensure that the governement kept financing the Parks Department budget, but that should not take away from the appeal of these clips. The reason these parks were preserved is that the views are scenic and spectacular and no amount of advertising jargon can take away from that. The Grand Canyon footage is the best of the bunch. The age of the films does not matter because the landmarks still look the same.
